alert.note: Alert for Houghton; Keweenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 3:20PM EST until December 25 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts of up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Heavy snow is anticipated. Winds could gust as high as 45 to 50 mph with higher gusts possible particularly toward the tip of the Keweenaw Peninsula. * WHERE...Keweenaw and Northern Houghton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM EST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Thursday night through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, plan on slippery road conditions tonight. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. For the Winter Storm Watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact both the morning and evening commutes. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, the greatest chance for gusty winds and blowing snow resulting in reduced visibility will be this afternoon and evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow combining with blustery conditions could cause significant travel impacts leading into the holiday weekend.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
